an11.17:1.3: “Knowing form” (_rūpaññū _) means being able to keep track of the herd by reckoning or recognizing them. | “Ford” (_tittha_) is a way across the river. | “Spreads smoke” (_dhūmaṁ kattā_) is the traditional practice of warding off flies and other  pests by burning cow dung, etc. | “Satisfy” (_pīta_) is less literal than “drink”, but clarifies the simile later on.
